description.narrative: This investment supports the Acid Survivors Foundation (ASF) to provide medical support and rehabilitation for victims of acid violence. Through the implementation of an Information Communication Technology (ICT) based response and support mechanism ASF will conduct awareness raising and advocacy initiatives that will bridge the gap between victims and services for women in Bangladesh on reducing acid violence. The proposed intervention will develop a subdistrict based electronic and print mapping of available emergency support services; introduce a phone alert system and helpdesk for quick response and referral; establish an e-clinic for medical, legal and psychological support; and provide tele-counselling services. The project builds on Australia's support to ASF for the provision of medical support and rehabilitation to victims of acid violence and to conduct awareness raising and advocacy initiative on reducing acid violence. The total value of this investment is $0.5 million over
